channel.title: maGaming RSS Feed
channel.description: A cleaned-up version of the original gaming feed

item.title: Duskpunk Review
item.content:encoded:
Duskpunk is a dice-based RPG putting you in a world where misery roams the streets of the city of Dredgeport, thanks to a combination of a seemingly never-ending war, criminal gangs, and the sway of the most powerful including the Emperor. You are a nobody who somehow escaped the butchery of the Front, but need to find your footing in a city where luck is thin and where relationships can turn sour quickly.

You have a choice of four classes in Duskpunk – Veteran, Writer, Criminal and Engineer – each of which has different starting stats. The veteran is a solid pick if you want to fight your way out of situations, with the disadvantage of not having the charisma or intuitiveness to find other solutions. The criminal class is for those who want to sneak around and use intuition. Engineers can construct workarounds for problems but are useless in a fight, while writers use their words to win arguments and bring people round. As you progress through Duskpunk you will earn ability points by completing tasks to up each skill, so can raise all of the stats to deal with most situations, as well as earning additional abilities.

Duskpunk’s gameplay is similar to Citizen Sleeper, but with different issues to keep track of and worry about.  Groat, the game currency that you use, is a big one as it will determine if you can buy food, shelter, and drugs to deal with stress. Groats go as quickly as they come, so you won’t ever feel financially comfortable. Stress can be raised by pushing beyond your character’s limits and through nightmares. As the stress meter builds, dice faces break, meaning your rolls as less likely to give you good outcomes. Initially, the only way to reduce stress is to take a drug which is expensive and hard to acquire, but as you explore more of Dredgeport different ways to reduce stress open up including meditation and talking to others. A wanted level can also appear depending on your actions, so you have to figure out ways to evade the authorities before they catch you. Health is another attribute to watch and if reaches zero then a skill becomes broken. These skills can be fixed by recuperating, but that costs time and Duskpunk is a game where time matters a lot.

You will find yourself mixing with different factions through Dredgeport, each with their own goals, from controlling the drug business, unionising, all the way too toppling the government. As you become familiar with these groups you will be given aims, aka missions, to undertake which can vary wildly from handing out pamphlets to digging up corpses. A majority of the aims are time sensitive and it doesn’t seem possible to complete them all, so you need to decide which factions appeal to your character more.

The representatives of each of these factions, such as Zai of the Machinists and Dresden of the Lich Dealers, are decently written but, for me, did not quite have the depth to pull me in to build a real connection with them. There are some powerful groups in Duskpunk, but the decisions you make are what really impacts the wider world, even through inaction or not completing an aim. While there are a number of choices to make, there are only a few real that your actions can lead to. It offers some replayability, but also shows that some actions you take will not have an overbearing impact on the final outcome, though they can impact the fate of individual characters.

A bit more of the world treating you as a just one person where events happen without your involvement would have been good too, making Dredgeport feel more like a real city that moves around you and not because of you. The story is pretty engaging and does explore a number of themes including workers rights, the balance of power in society, isolation, segregation, and survival. Again it is not the most in-depth look at these themes, but Duskpunk does provide an accessible way to learn about these issues and tie them to our own experiences.

For much of Duskpunk, you will either be looking at a map of Dredgeport to pick locations to visit, or reading the conversations you have with the different characters to advance the game. I like the user interface of Duskpunk, finding it easy to navigate and understand. You have the map, the aim journal, and an inventory to show what you are carrying. Aside from groats, you can also trade rumours, tip-offs, and rare goods for money or influence. The characters are nicely drawn too with each one having a really distinctive look, while the map has small details like birds flying around, the flow of the river, and smoke rising from the factories. A lot of work has gone into making the world seem alive, even if it is a map.



https://www.thesixthaxis.com/2025/12/01/duskpunk-review/
item.dc:creator: invalid@example.com (ResetEra_Newsbot

item.title: I've Been Playing Magic: The Gathering for Years, and These Are an Easy Cyber Monday Recommendation - Even Without a Discount
item.content:encoded:
The best way to play Commander.

Magic: The Gathering’s has a series of formats, but easily its most popular is Commander. It involves building a 100-card deck that works with a ‘Commander’, and buying a preconstructed deck is the best place to start.

Still, Wizards of the Coast did produce some ‘Starter Commander Decks’ in 2022, but they’ve been harder to find - and even tougher to get for their MSRP of 25 bucks. Thankfully, as we spotted in our Magic: The Gathering Cyber Monday deals, all five are in stock - and sitting pretty at the price they should be.

These are a great way to get started with Magic: The Gathering’s Commander format, and while there’s no major reprint value for collectors or longtime fans, they’re a pretty solid package.

Magic’s Starter Commander Decks Are In Stock For MSRP This Black Friday

There are five decks to choose from, and as I’ve covered previously, Draconic Destruction is an easy recommendation.

This red and green deck is a little slow in the early game, but grows into offering a fleet of dragons with big stats and flying to get around an opponent’s defences. Add in Atarka, World Render as your Commander, and you can give them all double strike when they attack.

It’s an easy to learn, easy-to-play deck, but it’s not alone.

Token Triumph is a green and white deck helmed by Emmara, Soul of the Accord. The game plan here is to build an army of tokens to overwhelm your foes, with some handy lifelink in there, too, to keep yourself in the game.

Chaos Incarnate is a red and black deck with Kardur, Doomscourge as the Commander. It’s all about getting everyone around the table to attack each other, while turning creatures dying into life loss and life gain.

First Flight is all about creatures with flying, and its Commander, Isperia, Supreme Judge, can hit for big damage and will get you plenty of card draw.

Finally, Grave Danger is helmed by Gisa and Geralf, and mills cards to the graveyard before giving you the option to bring Zombies back.

Lloyd Coombes is an experienced freelancer in tech, gaming and fitness seen at Polygon, Eurogamer, Macworld, TechRadar and many more. He's a big fan of Magic: The Gathering and other collectible card games, much to his wife's dismay.

Originally posted:

Nov 30, 2025 10:00 pm

In This Article



https://www.ign.com/articles/magic-the-gathering-cyber-monday-recommendation-even-without-a-discount

item.title: Battlefield 6 was cheater-free in roughly 98% of games after launch
item.content:encoded:
EA and Battlefield Studios have announced that an extraordinarily low number of Battlefield 6 games were ruined by cheaters in a recent blog post.

The post, shared on the Battlefield Comms Twitter account, broke down the performance of EA's Javelin kernel-level anti-cheat. Roughly 98 percent of online matches in the first week post-launch were cheater free in Battlefield 6.

Part of the anti-cheat's success has been attributed to the "invaluable" Battlefield 6 open beta. EA states that over 1.2m cheat attempts were blocked. In addition, users' adoption of Secure Boot leaped from 62.5 percent to 92.5 percent, a feature that proved frustrating for many but nonetheless is core to Battlefield 6's anti-cheat system.

EA stated the anti-cheat efforts continue, with the total block figure now up to 2.39m (each block meaning an individual attempt to use cheating software). Sadly, there are still 1.5 percent of impacted players unable to activate Secure Boot on their PCs, meaning they can't actually launch and play Battlefield 6 even after troubleshooting efforts.

Finally, EA is aware of 190 cheat-related programs, hardware, vendors, and resellers. The post states: "183 of them (96.3 percent) have announced feature failures, detection notices, downtime, and/or taken their cheats offline entirely."

The post concluded by laying out a variety of steps the EA team will take to improve the anti-cheat moving forward, the war between cheaters and anti-cheat software being an endless struggle. Still, as it stands today, these are impressive statistics that show Battlefield 6 should be a largely fair and enjoyable game to play online. Here's hoping EA can keep this momentum through to the foreseeable future.

Battlefield 6 remains very popular, even as the staggering launch drifts into the past. If you've not tried it out yet, why not read Eurogamer's Battlefield 6 review to get an idea of what EA's latest AAA shooter is like.

Related topics


https://www.eurogamer.net/battlefield-6-was-cheater-free-in-roughly-98-of-games-after-launch

item.title: The Game Awards' Geoff Keighley teases announcement by placing a whopping demon-covered statue in the desert
item.content:encoded:
"regal.inspiring.thickness."

Over the weekend, The Game Awards organiser Geoff Keighley set social media tongues wagging with three words: regal.inspiring.thickness.

No, despite what I first thought, these are not the three words he used to describe himself on his Tinder profile. Rather, they link to a location via a What3Words address. And, that location leads to a spot near Joshua Tree, California.

To see this content please enable targeting cookies.

As you can see in the image I took this morning from the What3Words app, regal.inspiring.thickness is a rather barren looking area in California.

Well, at least, it may have once been, but others have since ventured forth to the spot, and discovered a large and rather imposing statue now standing proudly in a field in the Mojave Desert, on the corner of 29 Palms Highway and Yucca Mesa Road.

The statue itself shows a group of demonic creatures all surrounding a hellish-looking portal type design. This portal area lights up at night, as you can see via the second image below, with a fiery and quite ominous glow.

Many have surmised that this is all part of a tease for The Game Awards 2025, which is set to kick off later this month, on 11th December. But, what is it teasing exactly? The current most popular theory out there is an expansion or something similar for Blizzard's Diablo series. The statue's hellish iconography certainly would fit the bill.

Others have speculated the statue could be related to God of War, with earlier rumours suggesting the series would be heading to Egypt. Housemarque's next game Saros has also been mentioned in various replies and social media posts.

Meanwhile, many wishful thinkers have suggested it could be a statue leading up to a big Elder Scrolls 6 reveal, or perhaps a new Doom installment. I have also seen others mention Half Life 3.

Whatever it may all end up being, there is not too much longer to find out. The Game Awards 2025 will take place on Thursday, 11th December, at 7:30pm EST. That's very early in the morning on the 12th, if you are in the UK. Leading the nominations at this year's event is Clair Obscur: Expedition 33, which is up for 12 awards.

Last week, a new trademark for something known as Control: Resonant was registered in Europe, leading many to speculate developer Remedy has something up its sleeve for The Game Awards.

Related topics


https://www.eurogamer.net/the-game-awards-geoff-keighley-teases-announcement-by-placing-a-whopping-demon-covered-statue-in-the-desert

item.title: Escape from Tarkov Players Are Finding Black Division and RUAF Fighters on Random Maps
item.content:encoded:
Escape from Tarkov’s 1.0 update is settling in nicely, but players are finding that things are unfolding a little haphazardly. Ahead of the launch of 1.0, the world of Tarkov was introduced to Black Division, a new and high-tier faction that was reportedly set to patrol Terminal, the new ‘endgame’ map.

However, in recent hours, players have started encountering Black Division and RUAF, another new faction, on multiple maps, including Factory. Presently, it seems that they’re only roaming in PvE, which has led many to believe that Battlestate Games is using the PvE platform as a testing base before releasing into PvP.

Black Division is Roaming in Tarkov

In a series of shots shared by VeryBadSCAV on social media, we see clear evidence that Black Division fighters are being spotted on maps outside Terminal, the mysterious environment yet to be revealed by any Escape from Tarkov player.

The Black Division fighters were found in a Factory raid on the PvE platform, which has many thinking that Battlestate is using the mode to prepare for PvP drops of the newest factions, Black Division and RUAF. Users have also reported spotting RUAF fighters roaming on various maps in large packs.

VeryBadSCAV continued in later posts, suggesting that Battlestate Games is ‘sneaking in’ Terminal and the recently teased Winter Update that will blanket Tarkov in snow, just as it has the last few years.

Some players are sceptical about the imminent arrival of Terminal, and many are confused about the ‘soft lock’ situation. No Escape from Tarkov player has managed to make it to Terminal, with many having completed the game’s new story and sitting on a ‘wait objective’ that instructs them to hold fire until an escape path is outlined.

Until then, Tarkov players will need to be satisfied with Black Division and RUAF gunning for them at random across other maps.

Have you spotted Black Division or RUAF on any maps in PvP? Let us know where you’ve seen them on the Insider Gaming Discord server.

For more Insider Gaming coverage, check out the news that Call of Duty is getting a Street Fighter crossover

item.title: Call of Duty is Getting a Street Fighter Crossover
item.content:encoded:
It has been revealed that Call of Duty is getting a crossover that wasn’t on many prediction slates for 2025. On December 11, a Street Fighter collaboration is landing in Call of Duty Mobile, bringing four legendary characters from the fighting franchise into the first-person shooter world.

The Call of Duty x Street Fighter crossover will yield new Operators, a host of themed weapons linked to the Street Fighter universe, and more exclusive rewards for those participating in the event through December.

When Does Street Fighter Come to Call of Duty?

Call of Duty Mobile fans can take advantage of the Street Fighter crossover starting December 11, when the Hero’s Collection Operator Series Armory opens up, officially introducing the Street Fighter characters to COD Mobile.

The lineup includes some of the most recognizable characters from the fighting game’s roster:

  • Ryu
  • Chun-Li
  • Akuma
  • Cammy

On December 13, the crossover will be expanded via the Champion’s Collection Weapon Series Armory, which introduces the unique weapon skins to bolster the collaboration.

It’s a bold crossover that nobody really anticipated, but it’s a welcome one nonetheless. Call of Duty Mobile is, without a doubt, the most expansive and popular COD title ever made, and it’s doing the live-service model perfectly compared to the annual releases of the core multiplayer shooters.

This collaboration heralds the game’s sixth anniversary, and it’s the latest in a very long line of crossover events. In recent history, we’ve seen the likes of Gundam, Nier, Rambo, and even sporting icons like Lionel Messi make their way into the Call of Duty Mobile universe.

Will you be participating in Call of Duty Mobile’s Street Fighter crossover? Let us know what you’re thinking on the Insider Gaming Discord server.

For more Insider Gaming coverage, check out the news that Turok Origins could be released in 2026

item.title: Gentle Mates Beat OpTic Texas To Win Kaysan’s $50k Tournament
item.content:encoded:
The all-new Gentle Mates CDL roster has stepped up and shocked the scene to secure a win in Kaysan’s $50,000 Black Ops 7 tournament. The Kaysan Showdown VIII was the perfect opener for the Black Ops 7 season, pulling together four teams with unparalleled prospects for the upcoming year of competitive play.

It was FaZe Vegas, LA Thieves, OpTic Texas, and Gentle Mates that took to the stage, but when the dust settled, it was a surprise for many to see Gentle Mates standing with the trophy (virtually, of course).

An Unpredictable Season

On paper, nobody would have thought that Gentle Mates would beat the other three teams. You’ve got the back-to-back-to-back world champions in OpTic Texas, the cash-backed ‘super team’ in LA Thieves, and FaZe Vegas, a new, rebranded roster with serious potential.

Gentle Mates unveiled its new roster just days ago, revealing the squad that will carry the hopes of the French organization through the 2026 CDL season. If Kaysan’s tournament is anything to go by, those hopes are high.

The clips emerging from the tournament, which was an online event, were white-hot, showcasing a blistering Gentle Mates side that leaned heavily into the fast-flowing nature of Black Ops 7, which launched last month to a mixed reception at best.

Gentle Mates is going all in with this Call of Duty League roster through the 2026 season. Last year was a poor showing for the organization, which only just surfaced in the COD space after acquiring the LAG spot and rebranding for the impending season.

The new roster signing, a jersey refresh, and promoting some new sponsorships, like a clean Scuf controller variety, are all indications of Gentle Mates’ investment in Call of Duty.

Did you check out Kaysan’s $50k tournament? Let us know on the Insider Gaming Discord server what you thought about the event.

For more Insider Gaming esports, check out the news that Team Liquid Brazil won the VALORANT Game Changers Championship

item.title: Team Liquid Brazil Claims Trophy at VALORANT Game Changers Championship
item.content:encoded:
The VALORANT Game Changers Championship, a massive $500,000 tournament, has wrapped in South Korea, leaving Team Liquid Brazil the victor over all comers. Ten of the best women’s and marginalized-gender teams came together in Seoul to fight for a considerable prize, and in the closing moments of the tournament, it all came down to two rival teams.

The Grand Final was a dramatic showdown between Team Liquid Brazil and Shopify Rebellion Gold, two of the most capable squads in the Game Changers scene. What unravelled was one hell of a VALORANT series.

Team Liquid Secures $180,000 in Seoul

Shopify Rebellion Gold broke into the Grand Final after a defiant lower-bracket run, meeting Team Liquid, the tournament’s dominant upper-bracket organisation sitting on a white-hot streak. The best-of-five final lived up to the expectations set by fans, with both sides trading maps as the series unravelled.

Shopify led the charge with an easy win on Haven, but the series was set to go the distance, and it went down to the wire on the final map.

Team Liquid’s win denied Shopify a third consecutive Game Changers Championship win, and it was a redemption of sorts for the former team, having collapsed against Shopify during the 2023 Championship Final.

Beyond the Grand Final, the Game Changers tournament in Seoul represented the power of the Americas in the VALORANT space. MIBR GC and KRU Blaze brought up the rear, securing a third- and fourth-place finish, respectively, both of which hail from South America.

Team Liquid walks away from Seoul with the trophy and $180,000 in earnings, which is a nice payday after a hard-fought tournament.

Did you check out this year’s VALORANT Game Changers Championship? Let us know what you thought on the Insider Gaming Discord server.

For more Insider Gaming esports, check out the news that Gentlemates revealed its Call of Duty League roster

item.title: Turok Origins To Be Released in 2026, Dev Claims
item.content:encoded:
Turok Origins was given a short but sweet reveal trailer by Saber Interactive almost a year ago, and since then, things have run quiet. We’ve got a few details about the game, and fans of the title have busied themselves pulling every shred of information out of that trailer, but until now, Saber has remained mostly silent on the topic.

Recently, one developer’s profile was uncovered on LinkedIn, bearing a clear indication that Turok Origins, which doesn’t have a release window at present, will launch in 2026.

When is Turok Origins Coming Out?

If you head over to the Turok Origins website, you’ll see that it can be wishlisted on PlayStation 5, Xbox Series XS, and Steam, but there’s no indication of a release window – not even a year.

It has been a fair while since Turok Origins was revealed, and fans are wondering when this all-new dinosaur-slaying epic could drop.

It was recently discovered on a developer’s LinkedIn profile that Turok Origins is ‘forthcoming’ in 2026:

The developer, a sound designer, also worked on Saber’s Radikal Fighters and is supporting the development of an ‘unannounced project’ at the studio.

Turok Origins is said to take players across various worlds as they explore a multitude of biomes throughout an immersive, ‘epic story’ that can be experienced either alone or with friends. The game has a diverse array of weapons and abilities to uncover, and it can reportedly be digested from both a first- and third-person perspective.

Here’s the snapshot trailer, in case you’re interested:

Does Turok Origins seem like your kind of game? Let us know if you’re interested in Saber Interactive’s dino-packed adventure title on the Insider Gaming Discord server.

For more Insider Gaming coverage, check out the news that a new GTA 6 development clip has leaked

item.title: Zan Collection announced for Switch
item.content:encoded:
• Switch

Due out on March 12, 2026 in Japan.

Edia has announced Zan Collection for Switch, which will include ports of three simulation games originally developed and released by Telenet Japan subsidiary Wolf Team. It will launch on March 12, 2026 in Japan for 6,800 yen (7,480 yen with tax).

The collection will feature the following three titles:

  • Zan II: Spirits (May 29, 1992; Super Famicom)
  • Zan III: Spirits (March 11, 1994, Super Famicom)
  • Sangokushi Seishi: Tenbu Spirits (June 25, 1993; Super Famicom)

In addition to the standard edition, a special edition will also be available for 9,800 yen (10,780 yen with tax), which includes a soundtrack CD and the official art book “Officer Memoirs.”



https://www.gematsu.com/2025/11/zan-collection-announced-for-switch

item.title: Suikoden Live broadcast set for December 16
item.content:encoded:
No new information to be announced.

Konami will host a Suikoden Live broadcast on December 16 at 1:00 a.m. PT / 4:00 a.m. ET / 18:00 JST, the company announced. You will be able to watch it on YouTube.

The broadcast, which will run for approximately three hours, will feature the Suikoden 30th Anniversary Memorial Talk in Genso Museum, and the Suikoden 30th Anniversary Orchestra Concert. There will be no announcements of new information.



https://www.gematsu.com/2025/11/suikoden-live-broadcast-set-for-december-16

item.title: Amazon Goes Full Liquidation on Fitbit Charge 6, Now at Record Low for Cyber Monday
item.content:encoded:
Amazon blew away Black Friday price expectations by lowering the price of the Fitbit Charge 6 to an all-time low, and this made high-end fitness tracking suddenly affordable for everyone. The big store decided to match that big discount for Cyber Monday and shows that it really wants to take over the fitness tracker market this holiday season.

The Charge 6 is a slim wristband that doesn’t look like a fitness tracker like bigger smartwatches and it has accurate heart rate monitoring, built-in GPS, Google app integration, and full health tracking. Right now, Amazon has this fitness powerhouse on sale for $99, down from its usual price of $159 (which is a new record low).

See at Amazon

Heart Rate Monitoring

The Charge 6 has the best heart rate monitoring of any Fitbit ever made, and it has better optical sensors and smarter algorithms that get rid of motion artifacts. That level of accuracy is important because the tracker can now send your heart rate directly to gym equipment that works with it via Bluetooth. This means you don’t have to wear chest straps like many cardio machines do for heart rate training programs. The built-in GPS keeps track of your outdoor runs, walks, and bike rides with the same level of accuracy as dedicated running watches.

The Fitbit Charge 6’s touchscreen interface lets you control YouTube Music, navigate Google Maps and make payments with Google Wallet right from your wrist. That ecosystem connection makes the tracker a useful everyday device instead of just a workout buddy. You can switch songs while you run, get turn-by-turn directions to new places, or pay for coffee without taking out your wallet.

Comprehensive health tracking goes beyond just counting steps as it also keeps an eye on heart rate variability, blood oxygen levels while you sleep, changes in skin temperature, and stress management through guided breathing exercises. Zone of Activity Minutes count how long you spend in high heart rate zones during workouts, so you get credit for intensity as well as duration.

With normal use, like 24/7 heart rate monitoring, daily GPS workouts, and notification sync, the battery lasts about seven days. This means you don’t have to charge it every night like most smartwatches do. You can track your sleep every night without worrying about the battery dying because it lasts for a week. You only need to remember to charge it once a week. The slim design fits comfortably under shirt cuffs and doesn’t get caught on clothes or make pressure points when worn all day.

Smart notifications keep you connected by showing calls, texts, and app alerts on the color touchscreen of the tracker. However, the only way to respond on Android devices is with quick replies. In addition to fitness features, calendar alerts, weather updates, and timer functions make the device useful every day. The Fitbit app lets you sync the device wirelessly with both iOS and Android phones and it also has detailed analytics, trend tracking, and social features that let you compete with friends through challenges.

When you think about how much similar fitness trackers cost (between $150 and $200 without Google integration or heart rate broadcasting from gym equipment) getting the Fitbit Charge 6 for $99 is a great deal. For less than $100, you can get a tracker that will help you train smarter, learn more about your body, and stay in touch all day long.

See at Amazon



https://kotaku.com/amazon-goes-full-liquidation-on-fitbit-charge-6-now-at-record-low-for-cyber-monday-2000648957

item.title: A Short In-Development Video of GTA 6 Has Surfaced Online
item.content:encoded:
A small yet highly credible video clip of GTA 6 has surfaced online. While it is from an in-development build, it does give fans an interesting insight as to how the game will look, gameplay-wise.

As one of 2026’s biggest upcoming games, Rockstar’s Grand Theft Auto 6 has a lot riding on it. Through countless delays, fans have been eagerly anticipating driving and robbing the state of Leonida for almost 10 years. Unfortunately, the trailers have seemingly only shown cutscenes, with raw gameplay yet to be put on display. That is, however, until now, as a former Rockstar employee’s demo reel has surfaced featuring a small video snippet of potential gameplay from GTA 6.

Former Rockstar Employee’s Video Portfolio Includes GTA 6 Gameplay

Twitter user SynthPotato found the clip from a former Rockstar employee’s demo reel portfolio. The name of the employee was, of course, not disclosed. Still, the reel has several animations from other Rockstar games like Max Payne 3 and Red Dead Redemption 2, furthering its validity. From the looks of it, it seems the employee worked on a bit of GTA 6 prior to leaving.

As for what the clip is, it’s not a lot. The video, available above, simply shows a character (unsure if NPC or player) dismounting from vehicles. While the first half shows a bike, the second has a render of Vice City, alongside what appears to be Lucia, one of GTA 6’s playable characters. It looks like it showcases how many ways the player character can dismount from a car, which is a rather neat detail.

Unfortunately, the video is all fans have to go off of for GTA 6’s gameplay. With the recent November 19th, 2026, delay, it may be some time before more is shown. However, if the level of detail for even the simplest of vehicle dismounts is any indication, it might be the most realistic entry yet.

What do you think of the GTA 6 video leak? Does it look better than you thought? Excited to see more? Leave a comment below and on the official Insider Gaming Discord!

For more GTA 6, check out coverage on the ongoing legal battle at Rockstar and the last trailer. Make sure to subscribe to Insider Gaming’s weekly newsletter!

item.title: Fortnite Chapter 7 Season 1: Exotic and Mythic Weapons And Items Guide
item.content:encoded:
GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

Fortnite Chapter 7 has totally revamped the Battle Royale loot pool in the new season, and the new arsenal is mostly made up of weapons we've never had before. Likewise, Epic has added a few new types of items that have no real precedent in Fortnite, and some of them are exceptionally powerful.

But for this story, the biggest new addition is the boss kits, which drop when you defeat an NPC boss. These kits are locked in your inventory until you win the round or die, make you look like the boss the kit came from, and give you increased health and stamina, and an ability unique to that boss that you have to activate manually by using the item. Oh, and it shows everyone on the map exactly where you are.

There are three of these bosses at the moment, and they rotate randomly between five locations: Ripped Tides, Classified Canyon, Painted Palms, and either side of the lake east of Wonkeeland. Without any further ado, let's see what we're working with in Fortnite Chapter 7 Season 1, from the deadly new weapons to the awesome new Self-Revive Kit.

item.title: Amazon Clears Out AirPods Pro 3 for Cyber Monday, Liquidates Black Friday Leftovers at Record Low Price
item.content:encoded:
Apple just came out with the AirPods Pro 3 a few months ago, and as usual, the company won’t directly discount its newest high-end earbuds. Amazon really stepped up on Black Friday with a big price drop on these great wireless earbuds and the good news is that the store decided to keep the discount going and even make it bigger for Cyber Monday. Right now, Amazon has them marked down to $219 right now, reduced from Apple’s standard $249 price, creating the best deal we’ve seen on these earbuds.

See at Amazon

Double Noise Cancellation

The AirPods Pro 3 block out twice as much unwanted noise as the already great AirPods Pro 2, and they create isolation that is as good as that of over-ear headphones, but in a small in-ear package. That better noise cancellation works by using microphones that pick up sounds from the outside world and computer-generated audio that creates exact anti-noise in real time.

When you turn on transparency mode, the earbuds let outside sounds in so you can hear conversations and environmental cues without taking them off. Apple improved this mode by adding active hearing protection that automatically lowers loud sounds from the environment like construction noise or subway screeches, while still letting normal sounds through.

The new acoustic architecture changes the sound quality by giving the bass more depth, making the voices sound incredibly clear across the frequency range, and making the vocals sound incredibly present. Dynamic head tracking and spatial audio make three-dimensional soundscapes that put sound sources around you in space. This makes movies and supported music feel more immersive than traditional stereo can.

Heart rate sensing is a real game-changer for earbuds because they have built-in sensors that track your pulse while you work out without needing chest straps or wrist-based monitors. The earbuds keep track of heart rate and calories burned during more than 50 different types of workouts, and they then automatically sync this data to Apple Health for full fitness tracking. When you connect your iPhone, you can use the activity rings, step counting, and the new Workout Buddy feature powered by Apple Intelligence that gives you personalized training suggestions.

Apple Intelligence’s live translation feature makes it possible to talk to people who speak different languages by providing real-time translation. The feature works by processing speech on your iPhone and translating between supported languages, and the translation plays through your earbuds while the other person hears their native language through your phone’s speaker. This conversational translation works well enough for travel, business meetings, or casual conversations where language differences would normally make it hard to communicate.

When you turn on active noise cancellation, the battery lasts for eight hours. When you use transparency mode with the hearing aid feature on, the battery lasts for up to ten hours. That runtime lasts through full workdays, long flights, or long listening sessions without needing to charge the case. The USB-C charging case lets you charge your device multiple times, and gives you more than 30 hours of total listening time before you need to plug it in. Five different ear tip sizes make sure that everyone can find a secure, comfortable fit that creates the right acoustic seal for the best noise cancellation and bass response.

When you think about how these just came out a few months ago and Apple never directly discounts new products, getting the AirPods Pro 3 for $219 is a good deal. These earbuds are on sale for Cyber Monday for $30 less than their regular price, and they have features that other products won’t have for years.

See at Amazon



https://kotaku.com/amazon-clears-out-airpods-pro-3-for-cyber-monday-liquidates-black-friday-leftovers-at-record-low-price-2000648949
item.dc:creator: invalid@example.com (ResetEra_Newsbot

item.title: Roborock Q7 Max+ With 9 Weeks Self-Empty Crashes to Record Low, Cyber Monday Goes Zero Profit for Final Clearance
item.content:encoded:
Roborock makes a lot more than just the high-end flagship $1000+ models that get a lot of attention in tech reviews and forums for fans. The brand makes cheaper models that still have important features like self-emptying docks and these are some of the best value options on the robot vacuum market.

For instance, the Q7 M5+ has 10,000Pa of suction, two brushes that don’t tangle, LiDAR navigation and a base that empties itself and holds up to seven weeks of debris – and it costs a lot less than some flagship models. The good news is that Amazon has just cut the price of this combo to $219 for Cyber Monday, down from its usual price of $359 and this is the lowest price ever.

See at Amazon

Easy to empty yourself without the high price tag

The RockDock Plus base station automatically empties the robot’s dustbin into a sealed bag that holds about seven to nine weeks’ worth of dirt, pet hair and other debris, depending on how big your home is and how messy it is. Because of that extra space, you can basically forget about taking care of your vacuum for almost two months.

Instead of emptying dustbins after every cleaning session, you can just check in every so often to change bags. The sealed bag system keeps allergens and fine dust particles from getting into the air when you empty it by hand and it makes it perfect for homes with allergies or sensitivities. When the bag is full, you can quickly lift it up and put it back down again without making dust clouds or having to touch the dirt that has built up.

The 10,000Pa HyperForce suction picks up everything from fine dust on hardwood floors to pet hair that has been stuck in carpets without needing to go over the same area more than once: That level of suction is comparable to models that cost twice as much, and it works well on all types of floors. Roborock made the dual anti-tangle system with JawScrapers’ main brush technology which stops hair from getting stuck in the roller and it also has a side brush that won’t get tangled even when cleaning up long human hair or shedding from double-coated dogs.

PreciSense LiDAR navigation makes precise floor plans of your home and shows where rooms and furniture are so that you can clean them more quickly. Unlike older models, this vacuum doesn’t bump around your space at random and instead, it follows planned paths that make sure it covers everything without going over the same area more than once. You can also use the Roborock app to set no-go zones so that the vacuum doesn’t go near pet food bowls, delicate rugs, or places with cables. Virtual walls make boundaries without needing to put up physical barriers.

This combination vacuum and mop can pick up both dry and sticky messes in one pass: It automatically switches between modes based on the type of floor and your preferences. With three adjustable water flow settings, you can choose how much water to use when mopping. For example, you can use light moisture on sealed hardwood or heavier flow on tile and laminate that can handle more water.

The vacuum works just as well on carpets as it does on hard floors because it automatically adjusts the suction power when it detects rugs or carpets and lowers it on hard surfaces to save battery life. The edge cleaning works well because the side brush can get into corners and along baseboards where dirt builds up. The design is small enough to fit under furniture and around chair legs which lets it get to places that upright vacuums can’t.

For $219, you can get the Roborock Q7 M5+ with its self-emptying dock and it is a great deal because similar systems from iRobot or Shark usually cost between $400 and $600. Here you can get a robot vacuum system that makes it easy to keep your floors clean every day.

See at Amazon



https://kotaku.com/roborock-q7-max-with-9-weeks-self-empty-crashes-to-record-low-cyber-monday-goes-zero-profit-for-final-clearance-2000648933

item.title: MacBooks Survived Black Friday and Apple Went Even Lower, New Record Low for Cyber Monday
item.content:encoded:
Apple avoids running direct promotions on its products but Amazon has taken matters into its own hands with aggressive discounting throughout this shopping season. The online giant crushed MacBook Air M4 sales during Black Friday after slashing prices significantly, but Cyber Monday brings an even deeper cut that pushes the deal into record territory.

Right now, the 2025 MacBook Air with the M4 chip, 16GB unified memory, and 256GB storage is going for $738, down from Apple’s standard $999 price and undercuts even the Black Friday deal by roughly $10 to hit an all-time low for Cyber Monday.

See at Amazon

M4 Chip Performance

The M4 chip has desktop-level performance that can handle tough tasks like editing 4K video, doing complicated spreadsheet calculations, or running multiple virtual machines without breaking a sweat. Apple’s second-generation 3-nanometer architecture packs more transistors into less space while using less power which means that it can process data faster and use less power than the already impressive M3 generation.

The 16GB of unified memory is a big step up from the 8GB base model that Apple used to ship and makes it easy to multitask across dozens of browser tabs, creative apps, and background processes. That memory architecture lets the CPU and GPU share resources without the slowdowns that happen on regular laptops when the graphics and processor have to fight for separate memory pools.

The battery lasts about 18 hours of normal use so you can get through a whole day of meetings, document editing, and web browsing without having to look for outlets. That level of performance stays the same whether you’re running on battery or plugged in, which is a problem with many Windows laptops when they’re unplugged. The MacBook Air is completely silent when it’s running because it doesn’t have a fan.

The 13.6-inch Liquid Retina display can show one billion colors and is 500 nits bright so photos and videos look great with bright colors and deep contrast. Text looks sharp at the native resolution, which is easier on the eyes than lower-resolution displays when reading or coding for long periods of time. That screen space gives you enough room to work on multiple things at once while keeping the laptop small enough to fit in most bags without taking up too much space.

Apple Intelligence integration adds AI features directly to macOS without needing cloud processing or paying for basic features. The system helps with writing, making content, and productivity workflows, and it does all of this on the device to protect your privacy. Your data never leaves your machine because it is processed locally. This solves privacy issues that come up with cloud-based AI services. Two Thunderbolt 4 ports let you transfer data at lightning speed and drive up to two external displays at the same time.

The MacBook Air runs macOS without any problems and all of your important apps, like Microsoft 365 Copilot, Adobe Creative Cloud, and Google Workspace, work perfectly thanks to Apple Silicon optimization. iPhone integration works great with features like iPhone Mirroring, which lets you control your phone from your Mac, Universal Clipboard, which lets you copy content between devices, and Continuity Camera, which turns your iPhone into a wireless webcam.

When you think about how much Apple charges for this exact configuration directly, $999, getting the MacBook Air M4 for $738 is a great deal. This Cyber Monday price is $261 less than retail and gets you professional-level performance and a high-quality build. It’s the perfect time to upgrade from old Intel MacBooks or cheap Windows laptops.

See at Amazon



https://kotaku.com/macbooks-survived-black-friday-and-apple-went-even-lower-new-record-low-for-cyber-monday-2000648940
item.dc:creator: invalid@example.com (ResetEra_Newsbot

item.title: Officially Licensed Nintendo Switch 2 Carrying Cases Get Cyber Monday Discounts
item.content:encoded:
GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

Multiple notable Nintendo Switch 2 carrying cases are on sale for Cyber Monday, including two officially licensed options that are consistently near the top on Amazon's charts. The RDS Industries Game Traveler Deluxe System Case is discounted to $25 (was $30). This case has enough room for the console, dock, and other accessories and is the No. 1 best seller on Amazon. For a more compact travel option, check out PowerA's Slim Case, which is on sale for only $15 (was $20). Both deals are expected to expire at the end of Cyber Monday (December 1).

Naturally, these aren't the only Nintendo Switch 2 carrying cases on sale for Cyber Monday. Multiple of the most popular unlicensed cases have also received discounts. The form-fitting Tomtoc Slim is discounted to $25.89 (was $37), and Belkin's Switch 2 Case is available for $22 (was $30) when you click the coupon on Amazon's store page. Belkin's travel case has a built-in stand for tabletop mode, a mesh pocket for small accessories, a padded insert with 12 game card slots, and a dedicated Apple AirTag holder.

RDS Game Traveler Deluxe System Case for Switch 2

$25 (was $30)

The Game Traveler Deluxe System Case is a great option for Switch 2 owners who want enough space for the official Dock Set but aren't interested in the large lunchbox-style form factor. From the outside, the System Case looks like a thicker version of the average Switch 2 travel case.

RDS designed the System Case with the Switch 2 in mind, but it can be used with the original Switch and Switch OLED thanks to the cushions on each side that double as brackets to hold the smaller consoles in place. Molded ridges protect the Joy-Con 2 triggers and provide an extra layer of protection beyond the ballistic nylon exterior. A padded, fold-out insert with slots for 16 game cards fully protects the screen.

The bottom side of the case has two compartments separated by a padded divider. The larger one has room for the Switch 1/2 Dock, a Pro Controller, or Joy-Con Grip. The smaller compartment is for a removable mesh bag with space for the official AC Adapter, an HDMI cable, and other small accessories. Elastic straps hold the accessories in both compartments in place.

The System Case also comes with two game card-size plastic cases for microSD Express and a cleaning cloth. The System Case has a padded handle and a rubberized zipper pull with the red Switch 2 logo.

If you want enough storage space for the Dock Set and a controller as well as other accessories, the Game Traveler Deluxe System Case is also available in a larger-size version similar to Nintendo's All-In-One Carrying Case. The larger version is $40 and isn't on sale for Cyber Monday. RDS also has two smaller options as well as a couple of bags--check out the full Game Traveler Deluxe lineup for Nintendo Switch 2.

PowerA Slim Case for Nintendo Switch 2

$15 (was $20)

The PowerA Slim Case is also officially licensed by Nintendo and on sale for Cyber Monday. The Slim Case has an insert with 10 slots for game cards. The insert doubles as a console stand for tabletop mode and protects the screen when traveling. With the exception of cartridges, the Slim Case was designed solely for the console and Joy-Con 2. The form-fitting, molded interior is wrapped in soft fabric.

The Slim Case is available in four different colors/themes. The Dark Heather Gray edition shown above is only one that's on sale for $15. A red Super Mario-themed edition with a bunch of Mushroom Kingdom characters on the front is discounted to $16.89. Other options include Metroid Prime 4 and a Pikachu-themed Pokemon edition.

Nintendo Switch 2 owners should also check out the Cyber Monday deal on Samsung's officially licensed microSD Express Card. Normally $60, the 256GB Super Mario-themed storage expansion is discounted to only $39 at Amazon and Walmart.

  • Lexar Play Pro 1TB MicroSD Express For Switch 2 Gets Black Friday Discount
  • DualSense Limited Edition PS5 Controllers On Sale For Black Friday
  • Check Out Over 200 Nintendo Switch Game Deals For Black Friday
  • + Show More More Gaming, Tech, and Entertainment Deals & Preorders Links (5)
  • Eight Nintendo Switch Exclusives Are 50% Off In Walmart's Black Friday Sale
  • The First PS5 Pro Deal In Six Months Is Up For Grabs For A Limited Time
  • Ghost Of Yotei PS5 Slim Bundles And Collector's Edition Get Huge Discounts
  • Save Big On 8BitDo's Stellar Ultimate 2 Controllers In Amazon's Black Friday Sale
  • Evercade Retro Handhelds & Cartridges Get Rare Price Cuts In Amazon's Black Friday Sale

Got a news tip or want to contact us directly? Email news@gamespot.com

item.title: ChatPlayground Packs 25+ AI Tools Into One at Nearly 90% Off, ChatGPT, Gemini, Claude, Perplexity, and More Included
item.content:encoded:
AI tools aren’t exactly the demons most people make them out to be; if you know how to use them right. At this point, there are more than a dozen options out there, each offering a whole bunch of beneficial features that you can use to excel in studies, research, and even in your professional life. If you want to compare them all in one place and choose what works best for you, we’ve got good news.

ChatPlayground AI is a platform that lets you explore and compare outputs from 25+ top AI tools side by side, in a single place. A one-month subscription usually costs $29, but Stacksocial is offering lifetime access to the platform for just $80, after a whopping 87% discount. It’s a leftover Black Friday deal, but it’s selling out fast. At the time of writing, over 500 subscriptions have already been sold, so you don’t have a lot of time left to save. Jump in on it while it’s still live.

See at StackSocial

All Your Favorite AI Tools In One Place

Starting with what the subscription gets you; it offers unlimited prompts across all the AI platforms, whether it’s GPT, Gemini, or DeepSeek. There is no lengthy requirement sheet with this one. Your system just needs to have the latest version of Chrome, Edge, or Firefox to get started. Once your purchase is successful, Stacksocial will send the relevant links and code to your email, which you need to redeem within 30 days of your purchase.

The platform gets you access to over 25 popular AI giants like GPT-4o, Claude Sonnet 4, Gemini 1.5 Flash, DeepSeek V3, and more. Entering a single prompt delivers instant results from various AI models simultaneously, letting you compare their responses and pick the best according to your needs. You can use it to create images using text, refine text, edit documents, generate summaries for research papers that would normally take hours to read, and get quick answers to all your questions. Importing your own files is supported just as well.

There’s a built-in web search feature for up-to-date responses, and you can even refer back to previous conversations you had with the AI tools whenever you want. The Chrome extension integrates the platform into your everyday life, making it easy to get the help you want within seconds, without even launching the program manually. Those struggling to get efficient responses can head over to the prompt library that includes a wide range of ready-to-use prompts for optimal results. Best of all, the models can understand and respond in over 100 languages, so you can use what you’re most comfortable with.

On a normal day, you’d pay around $619 to enjoy lifetime access to all these features, but this deal takes a massive $539 off that not-so-friendly price tag. But as you’d expect, it expires soon, so it’s best to grab it while it’s still live. If you want to explore more, other plans are also discounted. For instance, a lifetime subscription to the Pro plan is going for $50 after an 85% discount, while the Basic plan can be yours for $35, down from $204. That said, there are plenty of other lingering Black Friday deals on Stacksocial that are still going strong, even after the main event has wrapped up. It’s a great time to treat yourself to a service that feels slightly out of reach the rest of the year, and even gift it to a loved one!

See at StackSocial



https://kotaku.com/chatplayground-packs-25-ai-tools-into-one-at-nearly-90-off-chatgpt-gemini-claude-perplexity-and-more-included-2000648823

item.title: Amazon Out of Time With Thousands of Galaxy Tab A9+, Goes Zero Profit for Cyber Monday Clearance
item.content:encoded:
If you’ve been waiting for Cyber Monday to get a cheap Samsung tablet, your wait is over – and we’re not talking about the Galaxy Tab S11 Ultra which costs almost $1,000 with premium specs. Instead, we’re talking about a budget-friendly Galaxy Tab A9+ model that can handle everyday tasks without breaking the bank. Amazon has cut the price of this 64GB/WiFi version from $219 to $139, which makes it a great deal for an 11-inch tablet that can do a lot of things.

See at Amazon

11-Inch Screen

The Tab A9+ has an 11-inch TFT LCD panel with a resolution of 1920×1200 which makes text sharp enough to read and colors bright enough to stream video. The 90Hz refresh rate makes scrolling through social media and web pages feel much smoother than standard 60Hz displays, and it adds a little bit of fluidity that makes the whole experience better.

Dolby Atmos processing powers the quad speakers on all four edges which give surprisingly strong sound and it creates spatial sound that makes movies, games, and music sound better than most tablets in this price range. The speakers make dialogue clear without muddiness and are loud enough to fill a small room. This audio setup turns the tablet into a portable entertainment device that doesn’t need external speakers or headphones to enjoy content fully.

The Qualcomm Snapdragon 695 chipset and 4GB of RAM work together to handle everyday tasks like web browsing, email, social media, and streaming services without any annoying lag or stuttering. The 64GB of internal storage fills up quickly with apps, photos, and content that can be accessed offline. The good news is that there’s also a microSD card slot can hold cards up to 1TB which is a cheap way to add more storage.

With multi-window display, you can run more than one app on the same screen at the same time. For example, you can split the screen between a web browser and a note-taking app or watch YouTube while checking your email. This feature turns the tablet from a simple device for consuming content into a modest productivity tool that can handle basic work tasks or multitasking situations. Samsung’s One UI interface makes Android 13 work better on larger screens by using gestures that are easy to understand and tablet-specific layouts that make better use of the space than phones that are blown up to tablet size.

With Quick Share, you can move files between Samsung devices and even iOS devices with just a few taps. This means you don’t have to email attachments or upload files to the cloud when you want to share photos or documents. You can charge the tablet with a USB-C cable and it usually lasts 8 to 10 hours of mixed use, like streaming, browsing, and light gaming, before you need to plug it in.

You can save $80 on a tablet that has really useful features at a low price by getting the Galaxy Tab A9+ for $139 instead of $219. For less than what many 8-inch tablets with worse specs cost, you get an 11-inch 90Hz display, quad speakers with Dolby Atmos, decent performance for everyday tasks, and Samsung’s polished software experience.

See at Amazon



https://kotaku.com/amazon-out-of-time-with-thousands-of-galaxy-tab-a9-goes-zero-profit-for-cyber-monday-clearance-2000648929
item.dc:creator: invalid@example.com (ResetEra_Newsbot

item.title: Amazon Forgot Profit on DualSense for Cyber Monday, Drops Below Black Friday Price to All-Time Low
item.content:encoded:
The DualSense Edge controller from Sony is rarely on sale because competitive gamers and PlayStation fans who want pro-level customization always want it. The price finally went down to $169 on Black Friday which is less than the usual $199 but Amazon is going even lower for Cyber Monday, bringing it down to $159. If you waited until Black Friday to see if the deal would get better, your patience has paid off with this new record low that makes upgrading to pro controller features much cheaper than it was just a few days ago.

See at Amazon

Customized Controller

Sony made the DualSense Edge with replaceable stick modules to fix the most common problem with modern controllers: worn potentiometers inside the thumbstick assemblies that cause analog stick drift. If you use the controller for months or years and it starts to drift, you can just replace the module instead of the whole $200 controller and this modular method saves money in the long run and keeps your investment working like new.

What’s more, the two back buttons can be attached to either backplate and give you a total of four extra inputs that you can program to act like any other button on the controller. This placement lets you keep your thumbs on the analog sticks during important times instead of moving them to the face buttons and it gives you an edge in shooters where jumping or crouching while keeping aim control makes the difference between winning and losing.

You can set how far the L2 and R2 triggers travel before registering a full press with adjustable trigger stops. There are three preset distances that cover everything from hair-trigger sensitivity to full range motion. The shortest setting is best for fast-paced FPS games because it lets you fire weapons with very little finger movement, which cuts down on reaction time by milliseconds that are important in competitive play.

You can completely change the functions of any button on the PS5 by going to the accessory settings: You can also turn off certain buttons if you keep accidentally pressing them. You can change crouch from circle to a back button, jump from L1 to L2, or make your own layouts that work with how you remember how to play on other platforms. The controller saves these settings to three different profiles that are stored in the hardware: You can switch between them right away by holding down the profile button and picking the one you want. This means you can have a profile that works best for Call of Duty, one that works best for Fortnite, and one that works best for racing games without having to change settings every time you switch games.

The braided USB cable that comes with the controller has a connector housing that keeps it in place so you won’t accidentally disconnect it while you’re playing wired. This also means you won’t have to deal with the annoyance of losing connection in the middle of a match because the cable wiggled loose. The carrying case protects the controller and holds all the extra parts, like spare stick caps, back button sets, and the connector housing.

The battery life is a little shorter than the standard DualSense because of the extra hardware for customization features: It usually lasts 5–7 hours of active play while the base model lasts 8-12 hours.

Grabbing the DualSense Edge for $159 instead of $199 saves you $40 on professional controller features that typically command premium pricing across the gaming industry. With the Cyber Monday pricing ending soon, this record low represents your best opportunity to upgrade your PS5 gaming experience before stock clears.

See at Amazon



https://kotaku.com/amazon-forgot-profit-on-dualsense-for-cyber-monday-drops-below-black-friday-price-to-all-time-low-2000648926
item.dc:creator: invalid@example.com (ResetEra_Newsbot

item.title: Bose Held Back During Black Friday, Now Crashes Headphones to Record Low to Empty Final Stock
item.content:encoded:
Bose surprised shoppers who thought Black Friday deals were over by dropping the price of its QuietComfort noise cancelling headphones to an all-time low on Cyber Monday, and this makes it much easier to choose between Sony, Sonos or Apple models. These headphones are now $199 on Amazon, down from their usual price of $349 which is a record-breaking 43% discount that makes premium noise cancellation available at a mid-tier price.

See at Amazon

Great ANC Headphones

Bose designed these headphones with cutting-edge noise-canceling technology that uses both active electronic canceling and passive physical isolation from the over-ear design, and it makes a quiet bubble even in loud places like airplane cabins or busy coffee shops. The system listens to background noise thousands of times per second and makes sound waves that are exactly opposite to the noise coming in, so it cancels it out before it reaches your ears.

Aware mode changes things up by using external microphones to send sounds from the outside world into your ears: This lets you hear announcements, conversations or traffic without taking off your headphones. You can talk to people while wearing the headphones in this transparency mode, but voices sound a little different than when you hear them directly. You can also switch between modes with the push of a button, so you can do it right away when a flight attendant comes up to you or when you need to cross the street safely.

The audio quality has the warm, bass-heavy sound that Bose fans love with deep lows that make kick drums and basslines sound heavier without drowning out vocals or high-frequency details. You can change the bass, mid-range and treble levels in the Bose Music app to fit your preferences or make up for how you hear things. This changes the sound profile from bass-heavy to balanced or treble-focused, depending on what you like.

The soft memory foam and synthetic protein leather that make up the plush over-ear cushions feel good against your skin and make a good seal without putting too much pressure on your head. The padded headband spreads the weight evenly across the top of your head and stop the pressure points that make you uncomfortable after wearing them for hours at a time. These headphones are comfortable enough for long flights or full workdays without making your ears tired or giving you headaches.

With noise cancellation on, the battery can last up to 24 hours on a single charge which means you can go for days without needing to charge it again, even on long international flights. With USB-C quick charging, you can listen for 2.5 hours after just 15 minutes of charging, which is great if you forget to charge it overnight. When Bluetooth isn’t available or the battery runs out, the included audio cable with an inline microphone turns these into wired headphones.

Right now, you can get these QuietComfort headphones for $199 instead of $349, which is $150 less than the usual price for noise-canceling technology. You’re getting Bose’s best ANC performance, a battery life of 24 hours, comfortable all-day wear, and better sound quality for less than what Sony’s WH-1000XM4 usually costs on sale.

See at Amazon



https://kotaku.com/bose-held-back-during-black-friday-now-crashes-headphones-to-record-low-to-empty-final-stock-2000648922
item.dc:creator: invalid@example.com (ResetEra_Newsbot

item.title: Samsung Goes All-In for Cyber Monday, 34″ ViewFinity Borderless Monitor Is Now Priced Like a Budget No-Name Brand
item.content:encoded:
The last place you want to feel cramped is your computer screen. You can only keep so many windows and tabs open at the same time before a small screen makes you feel claustrophobic, and small screens for gaming? Yeah, they suck. This year make Cyber Monday the day you lose your big-screen FOMO forever — Samsung’s 34-inch ViewFinity Ultra-WQHD S50GC ultrawide monitor is practically begging you to click Buy Now at Amazon at just $210.

This Cyber Monday deal is taking an already well-priced ultrawide from a leading manufacturer — the ViewFinity S50 normally sells for $330 — and turns into an absolute must-have at 36% off. With this 21:9 ultrawide format creating an enormous horizontal space for work or play and doing it with outstanding resolution and super-fast refresh time, it’s one of the most versatile monitors available in this price range for Cyber Monday or any other day.

See at Amazon

More Space, More Potential

Unless you’ve already experienced the difference between a standard 16:9 monitor and a 21:9 ultrawide, it has to be seen to be truly believed. It’s not just the screen that’s bigger, the larger aspect ratio actually shows you more picture that is lost in 16:9 mode. That’s especially true for many games, where that extra peripheral vision comes in exceptionally handy.

The extra visual real estate isn’t wasted on a lousy picture, either. The Samsung ViewFinity S50’s WQHD (Wide Quad High Definition) images are delivered with a crisp 100Hz refresh rate and AMD FreeSync support for silky-smooth motion and no tearing. It’s HDR10 with support for over a billion colors and a 3000:1 static contrast ratio, so your photo or video editing work can be done on a sharp and color-accurate workspace, your streaming looks amazing and moves flawlessly, and your gaming is more immersive than ever before.

Here’s something your 16:9 monitor almost certainly can’t compete with — the ViewFinity S50 supports Picture-by-Picture (PBP) and Picture-in-Picture (PIP). You can connect two devices — a console via the HDMI input port and a PC via the DisplayPort, for example — and see them on the same screen at the same time. Or two PCs, or a PC and a Mac — you get the idea. It’s something a $210 monitor really has no business doing.

Flat Is Fine

Samsung’s vast fleet of high-quality monitors includes several curved models — the ViewFinity S50 is not one of them. But, while some people swear by a curved monitor, many don’t, and they’re the ones who will be most intrigued by an exceptional monitor that gives you the ultrawide 21:9 aspect ratio and larger field of view without being curved.

The performance of the ViewFinity S50 certainly isn’t diminished at all by not being curved, and with TÜV-certified Intelligent Eye Care features that include adaptive brightness, blue-light reduction, and flicker-free backlight, the ViewFinity S50 also won’t wear out your eyes.

Cyber Monday’s traditionally the day for amazing deals on tech upgrades, and if you have an average or slightly long-in-the-tooth older monitor, the Samsung ViewFinity S50 is most definitely going to be an upgrade. The $210 price at Amazon is also pretty much unbeatable.

See at Amazon



https://kotaku.com/samsung-goes-all-in-for-cyber-monday-34-viewfinity-borderless-monitor-is-now-priced-like-a-budget-no-name-brand-2000648828

item.title: The Witcher Books Box Set Drops to a Great Low Price for Amazon's Cyber Monday Sale
item.content:encoded:
The original Geralt of Rivia.

Amazon has been dropping new book deals since Black Friday, and one of the most popular discounts available has been on The Witcher books. Andrzej Spkowski's Witcher series is the basis for the entire phenomenon. The popularity of the series may have been elevated by The Witcher 3: Wild Hunt and the Netflix series, but its the original story that has inspired the dark fantasy world we've come to love.

The latest Cyber Monday deal on this box set drops the price down to just $33.79 for the whole paperback set. This is a lower price than what we saw last week when the buy 2, get 1 free sale was still live, so it's worth picking up as an individual set before the deals end tomorrow.

The Witcher Boxed Set Deal at Amazon

The Witcher Boxed Set

This convenient collection comes with a box to store all five books on your shelf. The spines all sport the same red binding, making them pop on your shelf. The main novels follow Geralt of Rivia, the titular Witcher, and his decades-long quest to protect Ciri, the child prophesized to have the power to alter the world. Here's what you'll get in this collection:

  • Blood of Elves
  • The Time of Contempt
  • Baptism of Fire
  • The Tower of Swallows
  • The Lady of the Lake

Not included here are the two short story precursors to Blood of Elves, The Last Wish and Sword of Destiny. These detail how many of our characters meet and give much deeper history and backstory for a better understanding of this world. The other two prequel novels, Season of Storms and Crossroads of Ravens, are required reading for anyone looking to experience the entirety of the saga. All four books are discounted on Amazon right now as well, so you can pick them up separately if you want to coplete the collection. All but Crossroads of Ravens feature the same style of cover and spine art, so they'll look really nice with on your shelf with the rest of the series. You can check out the full reading order of The Witcher books to see what you're missing or see our larger list of book box sets on sale today.

Other Witcher books included in the sale

Myles Obenza is a freelance writer for IGN. Follow him on Bluesky @mylesobenza.bsky.social.

Originally posted:

Nov 30, 2025 6:10 pm
